page.title: 13New Forest Ponies.
page.content: All ponies in The New Forest belong to someone and they, the owner, can be identified by the brand mark on the animal. People living within certain boundaries of the Forest are entitled to what is known as{Commmoner's {Rights.}These "Rights" are many, but one of them allows a New Forest Commoner the right to graze cattle on Forest land. According to some people in this area this right is being abused and ponies are foaling for a second time in one year without sufficient grass available. Due to this over-grazing some of the animals are in a poor state of health. This is the opinion of the staff of the two riding establishments which were visited.
